conclusion: Analyze the image to identify positions and sizes of shadows A, B, C, and D.
Reason through how shadows will change when light source moves downward, considering position and size.
Image shows four objects on a textured surface, each casting distinct shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Light source is positioned above objects, casting shadows.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast by objects on the ground with light source above.
When light source moves downward, angle of light changes.
As light source moves downward, shadows will move upward due to change in angle.
Size of shadows will increase because light source is closer to objects, resulting in longer shadows.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will move upward and increase in size as light source moves downward.
When light source moves downward, shadows A, B, C, and D will move upward and become larger.
